commands.json.description: Use the commands API to add keyboard shortcuts that trigger actions in your extension, for example, an action to open the browser action or send a command to the xtension.

name.description: The name of the Extension Command

shortcut.description: The shortcut active for this command, or blank if not active.

events.name: onCommand
events.description: Fired when a registered command is activated using a keyboard shortcut.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Update the details of an already defined command.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: The new description for the command.

description.description: The new description for the command.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Reset a command's details to what is specified in the manifest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the command.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Returns all the registered extension commands for this extension and their shortcut (if active).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called to return the registered commands.

functions.name: isModuleInstalled
functions.description: checks whether a PKCS#11 module, given by name, is installed

functions.name: installModule
functions.description: Install a PKCS#11 module with a given name

functions.name: uninstallModule
functions.description: Remove an installed PKCS#11 module from firefox

functions.name: getModuleSlots
functions.description: Enumerate a module's slots, each with their name and whether a token is present

types.description: Details of a content script registered programmatically

css.description: The list of CSS files to inject

js.description: The list of JS files to inject

allFrames.description: If allFrames is true, implies that the JavaScript or CSS should be injected into all frames of current page. By default, it's false and is only injected into the top frame.

matchAboutBlank.description: If matchAboutBlank is true, then the code is also injected in about:blank and about:srcdoc frames if your extension has access to its parent document. Code cannot be inserted in top-level about:-frames. By default it is false.

runAt.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab. Defaults to "document_idle".

types.description: An object that represents a content script registered programmatically

functions.name: unregister
functions.description: Unregister a content script registered programmatically

functions.name: register
functions.description: Register a content script programmatically

extension.json.description: The browser.extension API has utilities that can be used by any extension page. It includes support for exchanging messages between an extension and its content scripts or between extensions, as described in detail in $(topic:messaging)[Message Passing].

lastError.description: Set for the lifetime of a callback if an ansychronous extension api has resulted in an error. If no error has occured lastError will be <var>undefined</var>.

message.description: Description of the error that has taken place.

inIncognitoContext.description: True for content scripts running inside incognito tabs, and for extension pages running inside an incognito process. The latter only applies to extensions with 'split' incognito_behavior.

types.description: The type of extension view.

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Converts a relative path within an extension install directory to a fully-qualified URL.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A path to a resource within an extension expressed relative to its install directory.

returns.description: The fully-qualified URL to the resource.

functions.name: getViews
functions.description: Returns an array of the JavaScript 'window' objects for each of the pages running inside the current extension.

type.description: The type of view to get. If omitted, returns all views (including background pages and tabs). Valid values: 'tab', 'popup', 'sidebar'.

windowId.description: The window to restrict the search to. If omitted, returns all views.

tabId.description: Find a view according to a tab id. If this field is omitted, returns all views.

functions.name: getBackgroundPage
functions.description: Returns the JavaScript 'window' object for the background page running inside the current extension. Returns null if the extension has no background page.

functions.name: isAllowedIncognitoAccess
functions.description: Retrieves the state of the extension's access to Incognito-mode (as determined by the user-controlled 'Allowed in Incognito' checkbox.

parameters.name: isAllowedAccess
parameters.description: True if the extension has access to Incognito mode, false otherwise.

functions.name: isAllowedFileSchemeAccess
functions.description: Retrieves the state of the extension's access to the 'file://' scheme (as determined by the user-controlled 'Allow access to File URLs' checkbox.

parameters.name: isAllowedAccess
parameters.description: True if the extension can access the 'file://' scheme, false otherwise.

functions.name: setUpdateUrlData
functions.description: Sets the value of the ap CGI parameter used in the extension's update URL.  This value is ignored for extensions that are hosted in the browser vendor's store.

events.name: onRequest
events.description: Fired when a request is sent from either an extension process or a content script.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object, or undefined if there is no response. If you have more than one onRequest listener in the same document, then only one may send a response.

events.name: onRequestExternal
events.description: Fired when a request is sent from another extension.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object, or undefined if there is no response.

i18n.json.description: Use the browser.i18n infrastructure to implement internationalization across your whole app or extension.

types.description: An ISO language code such as en or fr. For a complete list of languages supported by this method, see kLanguageInfoTable. For an unknown language, und will be returned, which means that [percentage] of the text is unknown to CLD

functions.name: getAcceptLanguages
functions.description: Gets the accept-languages of the browser. This is different from the locale used by the browser; to get the locale, use $(ref:i18n.getUILanguage).

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: Array of LanguageCode

functions.name: getMessage
functions.description: Gets the localized string for the specified message. If the message is missing, this method returns an empty string (''). If the format of the getMessage() call is wrong — for example, messageName is not a string or the substitutions array has more than 9 elements — this method returns undefined.

parameters.name: messageName
parameters.description: The name of the message, as specified in the $(topic:i18n-messages)[messages.json] file.

parameters.name: substitutions
parameters.description: Substitution strings, if the message requires any.

functions.name: getUILanguage
functions.description: Gets the browser UI language of the browser. This is different from $(ref:i18n.getAcceptLanguages) which returns the preferred user languages.

returns.description: The browser UI language code such as en-US or fr-FR.

functions.name: detectLanguage
functions.description: Detects the language of the provided text using CLD.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: User input string to be translated.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: LanguageDetectionResult object that holds detected langugae reliability and array of DetectedLanguage

items.description: DetectedLanguage object that holds detected ISO language code and its percentage in the input string

percentage.description: The percentage of the detected language

management.json.description: The browser.management API provides ways to manage the list of extensions that are installed and running.

types.description: Information about an icon belonging to an extension.

size.description: A number representing the width and height of the icon. Likely values include (but are not limited to) 128, 48, 24, and 16.

url.description: The URL for this icon image. To display a grayscale version of the icon (to indicate that an extension is disabled, for example), append ?grayscale=true to the URL.

types.description: A reason the item is disabled.
The type of this extension, 'extension' or 'theme'.

How the extension was installed. One of
development: The extension was loaded unpacked in developer mode,
normal: The extension was installed normally via an .xpi file,
sideload: The extension was installed by other software on the machine,
other: The extension was installed by other means.
Information about an installed extension.

shortName.description: A short version of the name of this extension.

versionName.description: The version name of this extension if the manifest specified one.

mayDisable.description: Whether this extension can be disabled or uninstalled by the user.

enabled.description: Whether it is currently enabled or disabled.

disabledReason.description: A reason the item is disabled.

type.description: The type of this extension, 'extension' or 'theme'.

homepageUrl.description: The URL of the homepage of this extension.

updateUrl.description: The update URL of this extension.

optionsUrl.description: The url for the item's options page, if it has one.

icons.description: A list of icon information. Note that this just reflects what was declared in the manifest, and the actual image at that url may be larger or smaller than what was declared, so you might consider using explicit width and height attributes on img tags referencing these images. See the manifest documentation on icons for more details.

permissions.description: Returns a list of API based permissions.

hostPermissions.description: Returns a list of host based permissions.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Returns a list of information about installed extensions.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Returns information about the installed extension that has the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID from an item of $(ref:management.ExtensionInfo).

functions.name: install
functions.description: Installs and enables a theme extension from the given url.

url.description: URL pointing to the XPI file on addons.mozilla.org or similar.

hash.description: A hash of the XPI file, using sha256 or stronger.

functions.name: getSelf
functions.description: Returns information about the calling extension. Note: This function can be used without requesting the 'management' permission in the manifest.

functions.name: uninstallSelf
functions.description: Uninstalls the calling extension. Note: This function can be used without requesting the 'management' permission in the manifest.

showConfirmDialog.description: Whether or not a confirm-uninstall dialog should prompt the user. Defaults to false.

dialogMessage.description: The message to display to a user when being asked to confirm removal of the extension.

functions.name: setEnabled
functions.description: Enables or disables the given add-on.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the add-on to enable/disable.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether to enable or disable the add-on.

events.name: onDisabled
events.description: Fired when an addon has been disabled.

events.name: onEnabled
events.description: Fired when an addon has been enabled.

events.name: onInstalled
events.description: Fired when an addon has been installed.

events.name: onUninstalled
events.description: Fired when an addon has been uninstalled.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Get a list of all the extension's permissions.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Check if the extension has the given permissions.

functions.name: request
functions.description: Request the given permissions.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Relinquish the given permissions.

events.name: onAdded
events.description: Fired when the extension acquires new permissions.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when permissions are removed from the extension.

runtime.json.description: Use the browser.runtime API to retrieve the background page, return details about the manifest, and listen for and respond to events in the app or extension lifecycle. You can also use this API to convert the relative path of URLs to fully-qualified URLs.

types.description: An object which allows two way communication with other pages.

sender.description: This property will only be present on ports passed to onConnect/onConnectExternal listeners.

types.description: An object containing information about the script context that sent a message or request.

tab.description: The $(ref:tabs.Tab) which opened the connection, if any. This property will only be present when the connection was opened from a tab (including content scripts), and only if the receiver is an extension, not an app.

frameId.description: The $(topic:frame_ids)[frame] that opened the connection. 0 for top-level frames, positive for child frames. This will only be set when tab is set.

id.description: The ID of the extension or app that opened the connection, if any.

url.description: The URL of the page or frame that opened the connection. If the sender is in an iframe, it will be iframe's URL not the URL of the page which hosts it.

tlsChannelId.description: The TLS channel ID of the page or frame that opened the connection, if requested by the extension or app, and if available.

types.description: The operating system the browser is running on.
The machine's processor architecture.
An object containing information about the current platform.

os.description: The operating system the browser is running on.

nacl_arch.description: The native client architecture. This may be different from arch on some platforms.

types.description: An object containing information about the current browser.

name.description: The name of the browser, for example 'Firefox'.

vendor.description: The name of the browser vendor, for example 'Mozilla'.

version.description: The browser's version, for example '42.0.0' or '0.8.1pre'.

buildID.description: The browser's build ID/date, for example '20160101'.

types.description: Result of the update check.
The reason that this event is being dispatched.

The reason that the event is being dispatched. 'app_update' is used when the restart is needed because the application is updated to a newer version. 'os_update' is used when the restart is needed because the browser/OS is updated to a newer version. 'periodic' is used when the system runs for more than the permitted uptime set in the enterprise policy.

lastError.description: This will be defined during an API method callback if there was an error

message.description: Details about the error which occurred.

functions.name: getBackgroundPage
functions.description: Retrieves the JavaScript 'window' object for the background page running inside the current extension/app. If the background page is an event page, the system will ensure it is loaded before calling the callback. If there is no background page, an error is set.

parameters.name: backgroundPage
parameters.description: The JavaScript 'window' object for the background page.

functions.name: openOptionsPage
functions.description:
Open your Extension's options page, if possible.

The precise behavior may depend on your manifest's $(topic:optionsV2)[options_ui] or $(topic:options)[options_page] key, or what the browser happens to support at the time.

If your Extension does not declare an options page, or the browser failed to create one for some other reason, the callback will set $(ref:lastError).

functions.name: getManifest
functions.description: Returns details about the app or extension from the manifest. The object returned is a serialization of the full $(topic:manifest)[manifest file].

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Converts a relative path within an app/extension install directory to a fully-qualified URL.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A path to a resource within an app/extension expressed relative to its install directory.

returns.description: The fully-qualified URL to the resource.

functions.name: setUninstallURL
functions.description: Sets the URL to be visited upon uninstallation. This may be used to clean up server-side data, do analytics, and implement surveys. Maximum 255 characters.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to be opened after the extension is uninstalled. This URL must have an http: or https: scheme. Set an empty string to not open a new tab upon uninstallation.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the uninstall URL is set. If the given URL is invalid, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reloads the app or extension.

functions.name: requestUpdateCheck
functions.description: Requests an update check for this app/extension.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Result of the update check.

parameters.name: details

version.description: The version of the available update.

parameters.description: If an update is available, this contains more information about the available update.

functions.name: restart
functions.description: Restart the device when the app runs in kiosk mode. Otherwise, it's no-op.

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Attempts to connect to connect listeners within an extension/app (such as the background page), or other extensions/apps. This is useful for content scripts connecting to their extension processes, inter-app/extension communication, and $(topic:manifest/externally_connectable)[web messaging]. Note that this does not connect to any listeners in a content script. Extensions may connect to content scripts embedded in tabs via $(ref:tabs.connect).

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The ID of the extension or app to connect to. If omitted, a connection will be attempted with your own extension. Required if sending messages from a web page for $(topic:manifest/externally_connectable)[web messaging].

name.description: Will be passed into onConnect for processes that are listening for the connection event.

includeTlsChannelId.description: Whether the TLS channel ID will be passed into onConnectExternal for processes that are listening for the connection event.

returns.description: Port through which messages can be sent and received. The port's $(ref:runtime.Port onDisconnect) event is fired if the extension/app does not exist.

functions.name: connectNative
functions.description: Connects to a native application in the host machine.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The name of the registered application to connect to.

returns.description: Port through which messages can be sent and received with the application

functions.name: sendMessage
functions.description: Sends a single message to event listeners within your extension/app or a different extension/app. Similar to $(ref:runtime.connect) but only sends a single message, with an optional response. If sending to your extension, the $(ref:runtime.onMessage) event will be fired in each page, or $(ref:runtime.onMessageExternal), if a different extension. Note that extensions cannot send messages to content scripts using this method. To send messages to content scripts, use $(ref:tabs.sendMessage).

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The ID of the extension/app to send the message to. If omitted, the message will be sent to your own extension/app. Required if sending messages from a web page for $(topic:manifest/externally_connectable)[web messaging].

includeTlsChannelId.description: Whether the TLS channel ID will be passed into onMessageExternal for processes that are listening for the connection event.

toProxyScript.description: If true, the message will be directed to the extension's proxy sandbox.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the message. If an error occurs while connecting to the extension, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: sendNativeMessage
functions.description: Send a single message to a native application.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The name of the native messaging host.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message that will be passed to the native messaging host.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response message sent by the native messaging host. If an error occurs while connecting to the native messaging host, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: getBrowserInfo
functions.description: Returns information about the current browser.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called with results

functions.name: getPlatformInfo
functions.description: Returns information about the current platform.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called with results

functions.name: getPackageDirectoryEntry
functions.description: Returns a DirectoryEntry for the package directory.

events.name: onStartup
events.description: Fired when a profile that has this extension installed first starts up. This event is not fired for incognito profiles.

events.name: onInstalled
events.description: Fired when the extension is first installed, when the extension is updated to a new version, and when the browser is updated to a new version.

reason.description: The reason that this event is being dispatched.

previousVersion.description: Indicates the previous version of the extension, which has just been updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'update'.

temporary.description: Indicates whether the addon is installed as a temporary extension.

id.description: Indicates the ID of the imported shared module extension which updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'shared_module_update'.

events.name: onSuspend
events.description: Sent to the event page just before it is unloaded. This gives the extension opportunity to do some clean up. Note that since the page is unloading, any asynchronous operations started while handling this event are not guaranteed to complete. If more activity for the event page occurs before it gets unloaded the onSuspendCanceled event will be sent and the page won't be unloaded.

events.name: onSuspendCanceled
events.description: Sent after onSuspend to indicate that the app won't be unloaded after all.

events.name: onUpdateAvailable
events.description: Fired when an update is available, but isn't installed immediately because the app is currently running. If you do nothing, the update will be installed the next time the background page gets unloaded, if you want it to be installed sooner you can explicitly call $(ref:runtime.reload). If your extension is using a persistent background page, the background page of course never gets unloaded, so unless you call $(ref:runtime.reload) manually in response to this event the update will not get installed until the next time the browser itself restarts. If no handlers are listening for this event, and your extension has a persistent background page, it behaves as if $(ref:runtime.reload) is called in response to this event.

parameters.name: details

version.description: The version number of the available update.

parameters.description: The manifest details of the available update.

events.name: onBrowserUpdateAvailable
events.description: Fired when an update for the browser is available, but isn't installed immediately because a browser restart is required.

events.name: onConnect
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from either an extension process or a content script.

events.name: onConnectExternal
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from another extension.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Fired when a message is sent from either an extension process or a content script.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.name: onMessageExternal
events.description: Fired when a message is sent from another extension/app. Cannot be used in a content script.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.name: onRestartRequired
events.description: Fired when an app or the device that it runs on needs to be restarted. The app should close all its windows at its earliest convenient time to let the restart to happen. If the app does nothing, a restart will be enforced after a 24-hour grace period has passed. Currently, this event is only fired for Chrome OS kiosk apps.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason that the event is being dispatched.

headerURL.deprecated: Unsupported images property, use 'theme.images.theme_frame', this alias is ignored in Firefox >= 70.

accentcolor.deprecated: Unsupported colors property, use 'theme.colors.frame', this alias is ignored in Firefox >= 70.

textcolor.deprecated: Unsupported color property, use 'theme.colors.tab_background_text', this alias is ignored in Firefox >= 70.

toolbar_text.description: This color property is an alias of 'bookmark_text'.

types.description: Contents of manifest.json for a static theme

theme.json.description: The theme API allows customizing of visual elements of the browser.

types.description: Info provided in the onUpdated listener.

windowId.description: The id of the window the theme has been applied to

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a new theme has been applied

parameters.name: updateInfo
parameters.description: Details of the theme update

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Returns the current theme for the specified window or the last focused window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: The window for which we want the theme.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Make complete updates to the theme. Resolves when the update has completed.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: The id of the window to update. No id updates all windows.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: The properties of the theme to update.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Removes the updates made to the theme.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: The id of the window to reset. No id resets all windows.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Returns all mail accounts.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Returns details of the requested account, or null if it doesn't exist.

types.description: Indicates the type of a Node, which can be one of addressBook, contact, or mailingList.
A node representing an address book.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the program is restarted.

readOnly.description: Indicates if the object is read-only. Currently this returns false in all cases, as read-only address books are ignored by the API.

contacts.description: A list of contacts held by this node's address book or mailing list.

mailingLists.description: A list of mailingLists in this node's address book.

functions.name: openUI
functions.description: Opens the address book user interface.

functions.name: closeUI
functions.description: Closes the address book user interface.

functions.name: list

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: If set to true, results will include contacts and mailing lists for each address book.

functions.description: Gets a list of the user's address books, optionally including all contacts and mailing lists.

functions.name: get

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: If set to true, results will include contacts and mailing lists for this address book.

functions.description: Gets a single address book, optionally including all contacts and mailing lists.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new, empty address book.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Renames an address book.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Removes an address book, and all associated contacts and mailing lists.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when an address book is created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when an address book is renamed.

events.name: onDeleted
events.description: Fired when an addressBook is deleted.

types.description: A node representing a contact in an address book.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the program is restarted.

readOnly.description: Indicates if the object is read-only. Currently this returns false in all cases, as read-only address books are ignored by the API.

types.description:
A set of properties for a particular contact. For a complete list of properties that Thunderbird uses, see https://hg.mozilla.org/comm-central/file/tip/mailnews/addrbook/public/nsIAbCard.idl
It is also possible to store custom properties. The custom property name however may only use a to z, A to Z, 1 to 9 and underscores.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Gets all the contacts in the address book with the id parentId.

functions.name: quickSearch

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The ID of the address book to search. If not specified, all address books are searched.

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: One or more space-separated terms to search for.

functions.description: Gets all contacts matching searchString in the address book with the id parentId.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets a single contact.

functions.name: create

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assigns the contact an id. If an existing contact has this id, an exception is thrown.

functions.description: Adds a new contact to the address book with the id parentId.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Edits the properties of a contact. To remove a property, specify it as null.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Removes a contact from the address book. The contact is also removed from any mailing lists it is a member of.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a contact is created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a contact is changed.

events.name: onDeleted
events.description: Fired when a contact is removed from an address book.

types.description: A node representing a mailing list.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the program is restarted.

readOnly.description: Indicates if the object is read-only. Currently this returns false in all cases, as read-only address books are ignored by the API.

contacts.description: A list of contacts held by this node's address book or mailing list.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Gets all the mailing lists in the address book with id parentId.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets a single mailing list.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new mailing list in the address book with id parentId.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Edits the properties of a mailing list.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Removes the mailing list.

functions.name: addMember
functions.description: Adds a contact to the mailing list with id id. If the contact and mailing list are in different address books, the contact will also be copied to the list's address book.

functions.name: listMembers
functions.description: Gets all contacts that are members of the mailing list with id id.

functions.name: removeMember
functions.description: Removes a contact from the mailing list with id id. This does not delete the contact from the address book.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a mailing list is created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a mailing list is changed.

events.name: onDeleted
events.description: Fired when a mailing list is deleted.

events.name: onMemberAdded
events.description: Fired when a contact is added to the mailing list.

events.name: onMemberRemoved
events.description: Fired when a contact is removed from the mailing list.

theme_icons.description: Specifies icons to use for dark and light themes

browserAction.json.description: Use toolbar actions to put icons in the mail window toolbar. In addition to its icon, a toolbar action can also have a tooltip, a badge, and a popup. This namespace is called browserAction for compatibility with browser WebExtensions.

types.description: Specifies to which tab or window the value should be set, or from which one it should be retrieved. If no tab nor window is specified, the global value is set or retrieved.

tabId.description: When setting a value, it will be specific to the specified tab, and will automatically reset when the tab navigates. When getting, specifies the tab to get the value from; if there is no tab-specific value, the window one will be inherited.

windowId.description: When setting a value, it will be specific to the specified window. When getting, specifies the window to get the value from; if there is no window-specific value, the global one will be inherited.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the toolbar action. This shows up in the tooltip.

title.description: The string the toolbar action should display when moused over.

functions.name: getTitle
functions.description: Gets the title of the toolbar action.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the toolbar action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

functions.name: setPopup
functions.description: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the toolbar action's icon.

popup.description: The html file to show in a popup.  If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

functions.name: getPopup
functions.description: Gets the html document set as the popup for this toolbar action.

functions.name: setBadgeText
functions.description: Sets the badge text for the toolbar action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.

text.description: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.

functions.name: getBadgeText
functions.description: Gets the badge text of the toolbar action. If no tab nor window is specified is specified, the global badge text is returned.

functions.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Sets the background color for the badge.

color.description: An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255]. Can also be a string with a CSS value, with opaque red being #FF0000 or #F00.

functions.name: getBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Gets the background color of the toolbar action.

functions.name: enable
functions.description: Enables the toolbar action for a tab. By default, toolbar actions are enabled.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the toolbar action.

functions.name: disable
functions.description: Disables the toolbar action for a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the toolbar action.

functions.name: isEnabled
functions.description: Checks whether the toolbar action is enabled.

functions.name: openPopup
functions.description: Opens the extension popup window in the active window.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a toolbar action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the toolbar action has a popup.

instant_url.deprecated: Unsupported on Thunderbird at this time.

image_url.deprecated: Unsupported on Thunderbird at this time.

search_url_get_params.description: GET parameters to the search_url as a query string.

search_url_post_params.description: POST parameters to the search_url as a query string.

suggest_url_get_params.description: GET parameters to the suggest_url as a query string.

suggest_url_post_params.description: POST parameters to the suggest_url as a query string.

instant_url_post_params.deprecated: Unsupported on Thunderbird at this time.

image_url_post_params.deprecated: Unsupported on Thunderbird at this time.

alternate_urls.deprecated: Unsupported on Thunderbird at this time.

is_default.description: Sets the default engine to a built-in engine only.

condition.description: The type of param can be either "purpose" or "pref".

pref.description: The preference to retreive the value from.

purpose.description: The context that initiates a search, required if condition is "purpose".

params.description: A list of optional search url parameters. This allows the additon of search url parameters based on how the search is performed in Thunderbird.

name.description: Name of the cloud file service.

service_url.description: URL to the web page of the cloud file service.

settings_url.description: A page for configuring accounts, this is obsolete after Thunderbird 60.

management_url.description: A page for configuring accounts, to be displayed in the preferences UI.

events.name: onFileUpload
events.description: Fired when a file should be uploaded to the cloud file provider

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The created account

parameters.name: fileInfo
parameters.description: The file to upload

aborted.description: Set this to true if the file upload was aborted

url.description: The URL where the uploaded file can be accessed

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The created account

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: An identifier for this file

events.name: onFileDeleted
events.description: Fired when a file previously uploaded should be deleted

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The created account

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: An identifier for this file

events.name: onAccountAdded
events.description: Fired when a cloud file account of this add-on was created

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The created account

events.name: onAccountDeleted
events.description: Fired when a cloud file account of this add-on was deleted

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The id of the removed account

types.description: Information about a cloud file account

configured.description: If true, the account is configured and ready to use. This property is currently ignored and all accounts are assumed to be configured.

name.description: A user-friendly name for this account.

uploadSizeLimit.description: The maximum size in bytes for a single file to upload. Set to -1 if unlimited.

spaceRemaining.description: The amount of remaining space on the cloud provider, in bytes. Set to -1 if unsupported.

spaceUsed.description: The amount of space already used on the cloud provider, in bytes. Set to -1 if unsupported.

managementUrl.description: A page for configuring accounts, to be displayed in the preferences UI.

settingsUrl.description: A page for configuring accounts, this is obsolete after Thunderbird 60.

types.description: Information about a cloud file

name.description: Filename of the file to be transferred

data.description: Contents of the file to be transferred

functions.name: getAccount
functions.description: Retrieve information about a single cloud file account

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the account

functions.name: getAllAccounts
functions.description: Retrieve all cloud file accounts for the current add-on

functions.name: updateAccount
functions.description: Update a cloud file account

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the account

configured.description: If true, the account is configured and ready to use. This property is currently ignored and all accounts are assumed to be configured.

uploadSizeLimit.description: The maximum size in bytes for a single file to upload. Set to -1 if unlimited.

spaceRemaining.description: The amount of remaining space on the cloud provider, in bytes. Set to -1 if unsupported.

spaceUsed.description: The amount of space already used on the cloud provider, in bytes. Set to -1 if unsupported.

managementUrl.description: A page for configuring accounts, to be displayed in the preferences UI.

settingsUrl.description: A page for configuring accounts, this is obsolete after Thunderbird 60.

choices.description: A name and email address in the format "Name <email@example.com>", or just an email address.

id.description: The ID of a contact or mailing list from the :doc:`contacts` and :doc:`mailingLists` APIs.

type.description: Which sort of object this ID is for.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The message to reply to, as retrieved using other APIs.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The message to forward, as retrieved using other APIs.

theme_icons.description: Specifies icons to use for dark and light themes

default_area.description: Defines the location the composeAction will appear by default. The default location is maintoolbar.

composeAction.json.description: Use toolbar actions to put icons in the message composition toolbars. In addition to its icon, a toolbar action can also have a tooltip, a badge, and a popup.

types.description: Specifies to which tab or window the value should be set, or from which one it should be retrieved. If no tab nor window is specified, the global value is set or retrieved.

tabId.description: When setting a value, it will be specific to the specified tab, and will automatically reset when the tab navigates. When getting, specifies the tab to get the value from; if there is no tab-specific value, the window one will be inherited.

windowId.description: When setting a value, it will be specific to the specified window. When getting, specifies the window to get the value from; if there is no window-specific value, the global one will be inherited.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the toolbar action. This shows up in the tooltip.

title.description: The string the toolbar action should display when moused over.

functions.name: getTitle
functions.description: Gets the title of the toolbar action.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the toolbar action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

functions.name: setPopup
functions.description: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the toolbar action's icon.

popup.description: The html file to show in a popup.  If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

functions.name: getPopup
functions.description: Gets the html document set as the popup for this toolbar action.

functions.name: setBadgeText
functions.description: Sets the badge text for the toolbar action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.

text.description: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.

functions.name: getBadgeText
functions.description: Gets the badge text of the toolbar action. If no tab nor window is specified is specified, the global badge text is returned.

functions.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Sets the background color for the badge.

color.description: An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255]. Can also be a string with a CSS value, with opaque red being #FF0000 or #F00.

functions.name: getBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Gets the background color of the toolbar action.

functions.name: enable
functions.description: Enables the toolbar action for a tab. By default, toolbar actions are enabled.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the toolbar action.

functions.name: disable
functions.description: Disables the toolbar action for a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the toolbar action.

functions.name: isEnabled
functions.description: Checks whether the toolbar action is enabled.

functions.name: openPopup
functions.description: Opens the extension popup window in the active window.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a toolbar action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the toolbar action has a popup.

types.description: A folder object, as returned by the <var>list</var> and <var>get</var> methods. Use the accountId and path properties to refer to a folder.

accountId.description: The account this folder belongs to.

name.description: The human-friendly name of this folder.

path.description: Path to this folder in the account. Although paths look predictable, never guess a folder's path, as there are a number of reasons why it may not be what you think it is.

type.description: The type of folder, for several common types.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new subfolder of parentFolder.

functions.name: rename
functions.description: Renames a folder.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Deletes a folder.

tags.description: Object keys are tags to filter on, values are true if the message must have the tag, or false if it must not have the tag. For a list of available tags, call the :ref:`messages.listTags` method.

mode.description: Whether all of the tag filters must apply, or any of them.

text.description: String to match against the <var>recipients</var>, <var>author</var>, <var>subject</var>, or <var>body</var>.

recipients.description: Shows messages where <var>text</var> matches the recipients.

author.description: Shows messages where <var>text</var> matches the author.

subject.description: Shows messages where <var>text</var> matches the subject.

body.description: Shows messages where <var>text</var> matches the message body.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all mail tabs that have the specified properties, or all mail tabs if no properties are specified.

active.description: Whether the tabs are active in their windows.

currentWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the current window.

lastFocusedWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the last focused window.

windowId.description: The ID of the parent window, or :ref:`windows.WINDOW_ID_CURRENT` for the current window.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Modifies the properties of a mail tab. Properties that are not specified in <var>updateProperties</var> are not modified.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the active tab of the current window.

displayedFolder.description: Sets the folder displayed in the tab. The extension must have an accounts permission to do this.

sortType.description: Sorts the list of messages. <var>sortOrder</var> must also be given.

sortOrder.description: Sorts the list of messages. <var>sortType</var> must also be given.

layout.description: Sets the arrangement of the folder pane, message list pane, and message display pane. Note that setting this applies it to all mail tabs.

folderPaneVisible.description: Shows or hides the folder pane.

messagePaneVisible.description: Shows or hides the message display pane.

functions.name: getSelectedMessages
functions.description: Lists the selected messages in the current folder. A messages permission is required to do this.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the active tab of the current window.

functions.name: setQuickFilter
functions.description: Sets the Quick Filter user interface based on the options specified.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the active tab of the current window.

show.description: Shows or hides the Quick Filter bar.

contact.description: Shows only messages from people in the address book.

tags.description: Shows only messages with tags on them.

text.description: Shows only messages matching the supplied text.

events.name: onDisplayedFolderChanged
events.description: Fired when the displayed folder changes in any mail tab.

events.name: onSelectedMessagesChanged
events.description: Fired when the selected messages change in any mail tab.

menus.json.description: Use the browser.menus API to add items to the browser's menus. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

ACTION_MENU_TOP_LEVEL_LIMIT.description: The maximum number of top level extension items that can be added to an extension action context menu. Any items beyond this limit will be ignored.

types.description: The different contexts a menu can appear in. Specifying 'all' is equivalent to the combination of all other contexts except for 'tab'.
The type of menu item.
Information sent when a context menu item is clicked.

menuItemId.description: The ID of the menu item that was clicked.

parentMenuItemId.description: The parent ID, if any, for the item clicked.

viewType.description: The type of view where the menu is clicked. May be unset if the menu is not associated with a view.

mediaType.description: One of 'image', 'video', or 'audio' if the context menu was activated on one of these types of elements.

linkText.description: If the element is a link, the text of that link.

linkUrl.description: If the element is a link, the URL it points to.

srcUrl.description: Will be present for elements with a 'src' URL.

pageUrl.description: The URL of the page where the menu item was clicked. This property is not set if the click occurred in a context where there is no current page, such as in a launcher context menu.

frameId.description: The id of the frame of the element where the context menu was clicked.

frameUrl.description: The URL of the frame of the element where the context menu was clicked, if it was in a frame.

selectionText.description: The text for the context selection, if any.

editable.description: A flag indicating whether the element is editable (text input, textarea, etc.).

wasChecked.description: A flag indicating the state of a checkbox or radio item before it was clicked.

checked.description: A flag indicating the state of a checkbox or radio item after it is clicked.

modifiers.description: An array of keyboard modifiers that were held while the menu item was clicked.

button.description: An integer value of button by which menu item was clicked.

targetElementId.description: An identifier of the clicked element, if any. Use menus.getTargetElement in the page to find the corresponding element.

selectedMessages.description: The selected messages, if the context menu was opened in the message list.

displayedFolder.description: The displayed folder, if the context menu was opened in the message list.

selectedFolder.description: The selected folder, if the context menu was opened in the folder pane.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new context menu item. Note that if an error occurs during creation, you may not find out until the creation callback fires (the details will be in `runtime.lastError <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/lastError>`_).

returns.description: The ID of the newly created item.

type.description: The type of menu item. Defaults to 'normal' if not specified.

id.description: The unique ID to assign to this item. Mandatory for event pages. Cannot be the same as another ID for this extension.

title.description: The text to be displayed in the item; this is required unless type is 'separator'. When the context is 'selection', you can use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

checked.description: The initial state of a checkbox or radio item: true for selected and false for unselected. Only one radio item can be selected at a time in a given group of radio items.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'] if not specified.

viewTypes.description: List of view types where the menu item will be shown. Defaults to any view, including those without a viewType.

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

onclick.description: A function that will be called back when the menu item is clicked. Event pages cannot use this.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. Note: this parameter only present for extensions.

parentId.description: The ID of a parent menu item; this makes the item a child of a previously added item.

documentUrlPatterns.description: Lets you restrict the item to apply only to documents whose URL matches one of the given patterns. (This applies to frames as well.) For details on the format of a pattern, see `Match Patterns <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Match_patterns>`_.

targetUrlPatterns.description: Similar to documentUrlPatterns, but lets you filter based on the src attribute of img/audio/video tags and the href of anchor tags.

enabled.description: Whether this context menu item is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

command.description: Specifies a command to issue for the context click.  Currently supports internal command _execute_browser_action.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the item has been created in the browser. If there were any problems creating the item, details will be available in `runtime.lastError <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/lastError>`_.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates a previously created context menu item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to update.

parameters.name: updateProperties
parameters.description: The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the create function.

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. Note: this parameter only present for extensions.

parentId.description: Note: You cannot change an item to be a child of one of its own descendants.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been updated.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes a context menu item.

parameters.name: menuItemId
parameters.description: The ID of the context menu item to remove.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been removed.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Removes all context menu items added by this extension.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when removal is complete.

functions.name: overrideContext
functions.description: Show the matching menu items from this extension instead of the default menu. This should be called during a 'contextmenu' DOM event handler, and only applies to the menu that opens after this event.

showDefaults.description: Whether to also include default menu items in the menu.

context.description: ContextType to override, to allow menu items from other extensions in the menu. Currently only 'tab' is supported. showDefaults cannot be used with this option.

tabId.description: Required when context is 'tab'. Requires 'tabs' permission.

functions.name: refresh
functions.description: Updates the extension items in the shown menu, including changes that have been made since the menu was shown. Has no effect if the menu is hidden. Rebuilding a shown menu is an expensive operation, only invoke this method when necessary.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a context menu item is clicked.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. If the click did not take place in a tab, this parameter will be missing.

events.name: onShown
events.description: Fired when a menu is shown. The extension can add, modify or remove menu items and call menus.refresh() to update the menu.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the context of the menu action and the created menu items. For more information about each property, see OnClickData. The following properties are only set if the extension has host permissions for the given context: linkUrl, linkText, srcUrl, pageUrl, frameUrl, selectionText.

menuIds.description: A list of IDs of the menu items that were shown.

contexts.description: A list of all contexts that apply to the menu.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the menu was opened.

events.name: onHidden
events.description: Fired when a menu is hidden. This event is only fired if onShown has fired before.

menus_child.json.description: The part of the menus API that is available in all extension contexts, including content scripts.

functions.name: getTargetElement
functions.description: Retrieve the element that was associated with a recent contextmenu event.

parameters.description: The identifier of the clicked element, available as info.targetElementId in the menus.onShown, onClicked or onclick event.
parameters.name: targetElementId

events.name: onMessageDisplayed
events.description: Fired when a message is displayed, whether in a 3-pane tab, a message tab, or a message window.

functions.name: getDisplayedMessage
functions.description: Gets the currently displayed message in the specified tab, or null if no message is displayed.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Gets all messages in a folder.

functions.name: continueList
functions.description: Returns the next chunk of messages in a list. See :doc:`how-to/messageLists` for more information.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Returns a specified message.

functions.name: getFull
functions.description: Returns a specified message, including all headers and MIME parts.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all messages that have the specified properties, or all messages if no properties are specified.

subject.description: Returns only messages with this value matching the subject.

fullText.description: Returns only messages with this value somewhere in the mail (subject, body or author).

body.description: Returns only messages with this value in the body of the mail.

author.description: Returns only messages with this value matching the author.

recipients.description: Returns only messages with this value matching one or more recipients.

fromMe.description: Returns only messages with the author matching any configured identity.

toMe.description: Returns only messages with one or more recipients matching any configured identity.

unread.description: Returns only unread (or read if false) messages.

flagged.description: Returns only flagged (or unflagged if false) messages.

folder.description: Returns only messages from the specified folder.

fromDate.description: Returns only messages with a date after this value.

toDate.description: Returns only messages with a date before this value.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Marks or unmarks a message as read, flagged, or tagged.

read.description: Marks the message as read or unread.

flagged.description: Marks the message as flagged or unflagged.

tags.description: Sets the tags on the message. For a list of available tags, call the listTags method.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves messages to a specified folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to move.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The folder to move the messages to.

functions.name: copy
functions.description: Copies messages to a specified folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to copy.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The folder to copy the messages to.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Deletes messages, or moves them to the trash folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to delete.

parameters.name: skipTrash
parameters.description: If true, the message will be permanently deleted without warning the user. If false or not specified, it will be moved to the trash folder.

functions.name: archive
functions.description: Archives messages using the current settings.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to archive.

functions.name: listTags
functions.description: Returns a list of tags that can be set on messages, and their human-friendly name, colour, and sort order.

tabs.json.description: Use the browser.tabs API to interact with the browser's tab system. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange tabs in the browser.

id.description: The ID of the tab. Tab IDs are unique within a browser session. Under some circumstances a Tab may not be assigned an ID. Tab ID can also be set to :ref:`tabs.TAB_ID_NONE` for apps and devtools windows.

index.description: The zero-based index of the tab within its window.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the tab is contained within.

highlighted.description: Whether the tab is highlighted. Works as an alias of active

active.description: Whether the tab is active in its window. (Does not necessarily mean the window is focused.)

url.description: The URL the tab is displaying. This property is only present if the extension's manifest includes the "tabs" permission.

title.description: The title of the tab. This property is only present if the extension's manifest includes the "tabs" permission.

favIconUrl.description: The URL of the tab's favicon. This property is only present if the extension's manifest includes the "tabs" permission. It may also be an empty string if the tab is loading.

width.description: The width of the tab in pixels.

height.description: The height of the tab in pixels.

mailTab.description: Whether the tab is a 3-pane tab.

types.description: Whether the tabs have completed loading.
The type of window.
Event names supported in onUpdated.
An object describing filters to apply to tabs.onUpdated events.

urls.description: A list of URLs or URL patterns. Events that cannot match any of the URLs will be filtered out. Filtering with urls requires the "tabs" or "activeTab" permission.

properties.description: A list of property names. Events that do not match any of the names will be filtered out.

TAB_ID_NONE.description: An ID which represents the absence of a browser tab.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves details about the specified tab.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the tab that this script call is being made from. May be undefined if called from a non-tab context (for example: a background page or popup view).

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new tab.

windowId.description: The window to create the new tab in. Defaults to the current window.

index.description: The position the tab should take in the window. The provided value will be clamped to between zero and the number of tabs in the window.

url.description: The URL to navigate the tab to initially. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme (i.e. 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'). Relative URLs will be relative to the current page within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

active.description: Whether the tab should become the active tab in the window. Does not affect whether the window is focused (see :ref:`windows.update`). Defaults to <var>true</var>.

selected.description: Whether the tab should become the selected tab in the window. Defaults to <var>true</var>

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the created tab. Will contain the ID of the new tab.

functions.name: duplicate
functions.description: Duplicates a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab which is to be duplicated.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the duplicated tab. The :ref:`tabs.Tab` object doesn't contain url, title and favIconUrl if the "tabs" permission has not been requested.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all tabs that have the specified properties, or all tabs if no properties are specified.

mailTab.description: Whether the tab is a Thunderbird 3-pane tab.

active.description: Whether the tabs are active in their windows.

highlighted.description: Whether the tabs are highlighted.  Works as an alias of active.

currentWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the current window.

lastFocusedWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the last focused window.

status.description: Whether the tabs have completed loading.

title.description: Match page titles against a pattern.

url.description: Match tabs against one or more `URL Patterns <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Match_patterns>`_. Note that fragment identifiers are not matched.

windowId.description: The ID of the parent window, or :ref:`windows.WINDOW_ID_CURRENT` for the current window.

windowType.description: The type of window the tabs are in.

index.description: The position of the tabs within their windows.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Modifies the properties of a tab. Properties that are not specified in <var>updateProperties</var> are not modified.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

url.description: A URL to navigate the tab to.

active.description: Whether the tab should be active. Does not affect whether the window is focused (see :ref:`windows.update`).

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the updated tab. The :ref:`tabs.Tab` object doesn't contain url, title and favIconUrl if the "tabs" permission has not been requested.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves one or more tabs to a new position within its window, or to a new window. Note that tabs can only be moved to and from normal (window.type === "normal") windows.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab or list of tabs to move.

windowId.description: Defaults to the window the tab is currently in.

index.description: The position to move the window to. -1 will place the tab at the end of the window.

parameters.name: tabs
parameters.description: Details about the moved tabs.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reload a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to reload; defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

bypassCache.description: Whether using any local cache. Default is false.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Closes one or more tabs.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab or list of tabs to close.

functions.name: executeScript
functions.description: Injects JavaScript code into a page. For details, see the `programmatic injection <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Content_scripts>`_ section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to run the script; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the script to run.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after all the JavaScript has been executed.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result of the script in every injected frame.

functions.name: insertCSS
functions.description: Injects CSS into a page. For details, see the `programmatic injection <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Content_scripts>`_ section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to insert the CSS; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS text to insert.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when all the CSS has been inserted.

functions.name: removeCSS
functions.description: Removes injected CSS from a page. For details, see the `programmatic injection <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Content_scripts>`_ section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab from which to remove the injected CSS; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS text to remove.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when all the CSS has been removed.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a tab is created. Note that the tab's URL may not be set at the time this event fired, but you can listen to onUpdated events to be notified when a URL is set.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details of the tab that was created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a tab is updated.

parameters.name: changeInfo
parameters.description: Lists the changes to the state of the tab that was updated.

status.description: The status of the tab. Can be either loading or complete.

url.description: The tab's URL if it has changed.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Gives the state of the tab that was updated.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

events.name: onMoved
events.description: Fired when a tab is moved within a window. Only one move event is fired, representing the tab the user directly moved. Move events are not fired for the other tabs that must move in response. This event is not fired when a tab is moved between windows. For that, see :ref:`tabs.onDetached`.

events.name: onActivated
events.description: Fires when the active tab in a window changes. Note that the tab's URL may not be set at the time this event fired, but you can listen to onUpdated events to be notified when a URL is set.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab that has become active.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the active tab changed inside of.

events.name: onDetached
events.description: Fired when a tab is detached from a window, for example because it is being moved between windows.

events.name: onAttached
events.description: Fired when a tab is attached to a window, for example because it was moved between windows.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a tab is closed.

windowId.description: The window whose tab is closed.

isWindowClosing.description: True when the tab is being closed because its window is being closed.

windows.json.description: Use the browser.windows API to interact with Thunderbird. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange windows.

types.description: The type of window this is. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned type property.
The state of this window.

id.description: The ID of the window. Window IDs are unique within a session.

focused.description: Whether the window is currently the focused window.

top.description: The offset of the window from the top edge of the screen in pixels.

left.description: The offset of the window from the left edge of the screen in pixels.

width.description: The width of the window, including the frame, in pixels.

height.description: The height of the window, including the frame, in pixels.

tabs.description: Array of :ref:`tabs.Tab` objects representing the current tabs in the window.

type.description: The type of browser window this is.

state.description: The state of this browser window.

alwaysOnTop.description: Whether the window is set to be always on top.

title.description: The title of the window. Read-only.

types.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create. The 'panel' and 'detached_panel' types create a popup unless the '--enable-panels' flag is set.

WINDOW_ID_NONE.description: The windowId value that represents the absence of a window.

WINDOW_ID_CURRENT.description: The windowId value that represents the current window.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets details about a window.

populate.description: If true, the :ref:`windows.Window` object will have a tabs property that contains a list of the :ref:`tabs.Tab` objects. The Tab objects only contain the url, title and favIconUrl properties if the extension's manifest file includes the "tabs" permission.

windowTypes.description: If set, the :ref:`windows.Window` returned will be filtered based on its type. If unset the default filter is set to ['app', 'normal', 'panel', 'popup'], with 'app' and 'panel' window types limited to the extension's own windows.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the current window.

populate.description: If true, the :ref:`windows.Window` object will have a tabs property that contains a list of the :ref:`tabs.Tab` objects. The Tab objects only contain the url, title and favIconUrl properties if the extension's manifest file includes the "tabs" permission.

windowTypes.description: If set, the :ref:`windows.Window` returned will be filtered based on its type. If unset the default filter is set to ['app', 'normal', 'panel', 'popup'], with 'app' and 'panel' window types limited to the extension's own windows.

functions.name: getLastFocused
functions.description: Gets the window that was most recently focused — typically the window 'on top'.

populate.description: If true, the :ref:`windows.Window` object will have a tabs property that contains a list of the :ref:`tabs.Tab` objects. The Tab objects only contain the url, title and favIconUrl properties if the extension's manifest file includes the "tabs" permission.

windowTypes.description: If set, the :ref:`windows.Window` returned will be filtered based on its type. If unset the default filter is set to ['app', 'normal', 'panel', 'popup'], with 'app' and 'panel' window types limited to the extension's own windows.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Gets all windows.
